author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Nadigar Sangam has hit out against its former office-bearers – Sarath Kumar, Radha Ravi and Vagai Chandrashekar – following the sangam’s former president’s insinuation that the police complaint alleging ‘misappropriation and misfeasance’ of funds was initiated because of ‘personal enmity.’

In a statement released to the media, sangam president Nasser said the accounts were provided only after repeated requests.

“Our auditor said the accounts for the Nadigar Sangam Charitable Trust have not been properly maintained. Based on the auditor’s advice, we decided to lodge a formal complaint,” the statement said.

The present office-bearers could not be held responsible for the mismanagement of funds by the previous regime.

Panel decision

“We debated on what should be done, and the nine-member committee, which includes the likes of Kamal Haasan, S. Ve. Shekar, Ishari Ganesh and Kutty Padmini, decided to lodge a formal complaint. The decision was not taken by a single person,” it said, adding, “we condemn the comment that it was a decision to ‘seek revenge’.”
title: Nadigar Sangam justifies complaint against Sarath
